intro: Orbexilum pedunculatum var. gracile, commonly known as the slender orbexilum, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features showy, pink to red bracts that surround small, yellow flowers, which bloom in late summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Its unique floral structure and habitat preferences make it a notable species in arid ecosystems.
